relation: Categories
Campus Safety
Clubs and Activities
Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
the campus is located close to the downtown area. the area is not the best, but campus security has increased tremendously this past year.

over twenty different clubs to chose from, and the campus is very organized and has a large variety of activities to attend (book fairs, career fairs, speakers, trips-skiing, snowboarding etc., art shows, movie nights, enrichment lectures, concerts, etc.
students looking for a great education on a very nice campus in a smaller town
multicultural center is a wonderful center. a brand new state of the art gym was also just built. it has an indoor track, rock climbing, racquet ball rooms, fitness classes-yoga, boot camp, etc.

the campus is loaded with activities- game room, football games, friday night movie premier, guest speakers/lectures, one book fair, sac state aquatic center-canoeing, kayaking, swimming, bike trails, river rafting etc.
the food on campus is great!! there are a variety of places one can dine at including: panda express, subway, burger king, mexican food, java city, etc.
the course work is challenging, but the teachers are very fair. they have high expectations but give you all the resources needed to pass the courses.
prospective students: attend all orientations, get acquainted with the faculty and develop mentor relationships. ask questions, the teachers go above and beyond to help guide you!
the teachers are dedicated, knowledgeable, and passionate. they are an inspiration to student's who are on a quest for knowledge.
pageTitle: California State University-Sacramento Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {596077=Sacramento State was voted #1 Tree Campus USA in 2012 which is a cool fact and honor. The campus is filled with various beautiful trees and scenery., 992495=The dorm life is amazing!I had several friends that attended Sac State in 2008 so when I'd visit them I got to experience some of that life and it was extremely fun., 77556=The grass wasn't grass but mud, even in May. It smelled awful. It felt like a high school campus with lockers everywhere., 1001993=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 668851=A nice campus that has a ton of resources for students to use. There's friendly staff and students. The food there are so good and during the start of Fall 2013 Sac State will be opening a Starbucks!, 858485=I really like the food that we are provided with. Many times the school will give us the same type of food but I go trying out all the food there is and it is actually really good. There are hamburgers, pizza, beans, rice, lasagna, pasta, steak, and many more. What I do not like about our Dining is that they close pretty early. During the weekdays it closes at 8:00PM and in the weekends around 6:00PM., 633998=I know that there is a lot of things offered, from the aquatic center to things at the WELL (the gym on campus) if you are into that type of stuff. Some clubs like the ballroom dancing club offer things as well. Then there is Unique and they bring different things on campus so the students can enjoy, like this March they had a Taiko group performing., 663458=If you stay in the dorms, you have a meal plan. The courtyard market has some good sandwiches and pizza. The dining commons has good food but you get tired of it easily. It's buffet style so it's easy to gain Freshman 15. Starbucks will be opening Fall 2013., 61903=I haven't experienced dorm life yet, but will be experiencing in 2013}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students Anyone and everyone. Tips for prospective students California State University-Sacramento is known for it's prestigious educational value and ability to bring out natural-born leaders in every student. From educational studies to extracurricular activities to clubs of every ethnicity and interest, Sac State has a little bit of something for everyone in attendance to create a welcoming and comfortable place to be when away from home. Am enjoying being here It is a very free and fun environment which makes it a comfortable environment to learn in. Am learning a lot Each professor takes the time out to ensure that you understand the concepts of what they are teahing you and will work with you until you do understand. Login to rate or flag the reviews Kristina from Sacramento, CA 01/20/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 13 out of 15 people found this review useful. 4 of 239
